metadata.source: B. Kumar: "The Critical Edition of Yuktiṣaṣṭika-Kārikā of Nāgārjuna", The Tibet Journal 18.3 (1993), pp. 3-16.

body.translated_text: Now, the treatise named Yukti-Sixty, Salutations to <s>Mañjuśrīkumāra</s>, the youth

children.translated_text: Salutations to that chief sage who imparted the teaching of <s>Pratītyasamutpāda</s> (dependent origination),
By whom, through this method, are denied both arising and ceasing
Their thought surpasses being and non-being, unestablished in any abode,
By them, the deep, unsupported meaning of conditions is understood
The embodiment of all faults as long as it is existent is contradicted,

children.text: nirvartyate yathā yuktayā bhāvo 'pi śrvavaṇaṃ kuru || Yukti_2
children.translated_text: So indeed, by reasoning is non-existence too resolved, hear this carefully
If being were to exist truly, as imagined by the naive,

children.text: vimokṣastadabhāvena ko necchet kim na kārnāt || Yukti_3
children.translated_text: Liberation, by the non-existence of that, who would not desire, for what reason not?

children.text: vimokṣo nāsti bhāvena bhāvo nāsti hyabhāvataḥ |
children.translated_text: Liberation does not exist through being, being does not exist through non-being,
Even the great soul is liberated through the understanding of being and non-being

children.text: nirvāṇam caiva lokaṃ ca manyante tattvadarśinaḥ |
children.translated_text: The knowers of truth believe both <s>Nirvāṇa</s> and the world,

children.text: naiva lokaṃ na nirvānaṃ manyante tattvadarśinaḥ || Yukti_5
children.translated_text: Do not regard either the world or Nirvāṇa as existent

children.text: nirvānaṃ ca bhavaścaiva dvayameva na vidyate |
children.translated_text: Nirvāṇa and becoming too, these two indeed do not exist,
Comprehension alone of becoming is called Nirvāṇa
As in existence and non-existence, cessation is conceived,
This cessation created by illusion is accepted as true by the wise

children.text: samskṛto na parijñāto nirodho vibhave sati |
children.translated_text: Conditioned cessation is not known while non-existence prevails,

children.text: pratyakṣam bhūyate kasmin vibhavo jñāyate katham || Yukti_8
children.translated_text: How can perception occur in that, how is non-existence known?
If by the cessation of the <s>Skandhas</s> (aggregates), the affliction does not diminish,

children.text: yadā cāyaṃ niruddhaḥ syāttadā mokṣo bhavisyati || Yukti_9
children.translated_text: When it is restrained, then liberation will occur
The one who sees the origin of ignorance through true knowledge,
He does not discern any suitable generation or destruction

children.text: evam paśyati dharmaḥ yo nirvānam vā katam tathā |
children.translated_text: Who thus sees <s>Dharma</s> or <s>Nirvāṇa</s> in such a manner,

children.text: dharmajñānam paraṃ yatra bhedastu tatra vidyate || Yukti_11
children.translated_text: Where supreme knowledge of Dharma exists, there distinction is recognized
By whom the birth of the most subtle being is conceived,
He is unwise, not seeing the meaning born from conditions
If those monks free from afflictions are restrained from Samsara,

children.text: kutaḥ sampannabuddhaiśca tasyārambho na bhāṣitaḥ || Yukti_13
children.translated_text: Why is the effort for that not spoken of by the enlightened ones?
ārambhe sati caikānte bhavedṛṣṭiparigraḥ |

children.text: yaḥ pratītyasamutpādastasya purvaṃ paraṃ vā kim || Yukti_14
children.translated_text: What is prior and subsequent of this <s>Pratītyasamutpāda</s> (dependent origination)?
How is what has arisen first later restrained again?
Liberation devoid of beginning and end is like an illusion,

children.text: bhavatīdam yadā māyā namkṣyatīti tadaiva hi |
children.translated_text: When this being is known as illusion, it perishes right then
Defeated by knowledge of illusion, bewildered by that same knowledge

children.text: yathā marīcikā māyā bhavam buddhayā hi paśyati |
children.translated_text: Just as one sees water in a mirage by wisdom,

children.text: purvāntam vāparāntam vā na dṛṣṭayā parikliśyate || Yukti_17
children.translated_text: He does not suffer by seeing either the prior or the subsequent
Those who consider the conditioned as conceived from breaking and formation,

children.text: pratītyotpādacakreṇa vijānanti na te jagat || Yukti_18
children.translated_text: They do not comprehend the world through the wheel of conditioned origination
That which arises, relying on it, is not self-arisen at all

children.text: svayam yadā yadutpannamutpannam nāma tat katham || Yukti_19
children.translated_text: When it is self-arisen, how can it be called arisen?
What is extinguished is named so just by the destruction of causes

children.text: svabhāvena hi yatkṣīṇam tat kṣīṇamucyate katham || Yukti_20
children.translated_text: By nature, when something extinguishes, how can it be said to be extinguished?

children.text: na kaścidanutpannam nirodho 'pi na vai tathā |
children.translated_text: Nothing is non-arisen, cessation too is likewise not so
The intent and meaning of creation and cessation are demonstrated
From the knowledge of creation, cessation; from the knowledge of cessation, impermanence
And by realizing impermanence, the true <s>Dharma</s> is revealed
That dependent origination which is free from creation and cessation,
By knowing that itself, the ocean of existence is crossed over
Mistaken by view of existence and nonexistence are individual beings,
Beings caught in suffering lineage, deceived by self-conceit
It is contemplated by the learned that being is empty, impermanent, selfless
And the heap of defiling qualities is indeed seen as distinctive
Due to lack of root, there is no stability, unsupported, unestablished
Arising from the cause of ignorance, devoid of beginning, middle, and end
In the city of illusion, the deluded one sees the world as illusion
Here, the world of Brahma and others appear as if real,

children.text: satyanmṛṣetyuktamāryena tatra kā śiṣyate parā || Yukti_28
children.translated_text: But it is spoken thus by the noble one, what remains beyond that?
That world is blind from ignorance, moved by the stream of craving,
For the wise devoid of craving, where is the vision of merit equal?
Initially, this reality is seen, everything is said to exist,
Knowing things, not attached, discernment truly arises thereafter
He does not know the distinct meaning, only the hearing continues
Whose merit is uninterrupted, others indeed are worn out
Actions endowed with fruits are rightly declared in this world
The comprehension of their nature has been taught as never arisen
I and mine are spoken of by people following the effect,
So too are the aggregates, sense bases, and elements spoken of by the effect
The great elements and others are known as collections in consciousness,

children.text: tajjñānena viyukttena mṛṣaiva na vikalpitam || Yukti_34
children.translated_text: Separated from that awareness, they are falsely imagined
Nirvāna, indeed, is declared as the only truth by the conquerors

children.text: nāva śiṣṭam tadā satyamevam vijñena kalpitam || Yukti_35
children.translated_text: It is not left over then, thus conceived as truth by the wise
As long as there is distraction of the mind, so long it is the field of <s>Māra</s>,

children.text: evambhūto bhavedyatra nā doṣo jāyate kathaṃ || Yukti_36
children.translated_text: Where it is thus, no fault arises, how is this possible?
Since the world born from ignorance is proclaimed by the Buddhas,
This world is therefore fluctuation, why is this not appropriate?
When ignorance is restrained, cessation arises consequently

children.text: ajñānato hi samkalpa iti kim na vidhīyate || Yukti_38
children.translated_text: From ignorance arises conception, why is this not decreed?

children.text: hetutaḥ sambhavo yasya sthiti rna pratyayairvinā |
children.translated_text: Whose origination is by cause, not existence without conditions,
Dissolution cometh forth from absence of conditions, how is it understood as existence
Resting on supreme existence, if stability, for the advocates of being

children.text: tadaiva hi sthitā mārge na kaściditasmayastataḥ || Yukti_40
children.translated_text: Then indeed they are stable on the path, there is no one more amazed then
All are resting on the path of the Buddha, speakers of impermanence

children.text: kena vādena gṛhyante bhāvāḥ santi parā iti || Yukti_41
children.translated_text: By what argument are things affirmed, saying others exist?
Where there is no apprehension of discrimination as this or that

children.text: idam satyamado veti paṇḍitaiḥ kathamucyatai || Yukti_42
children.translated_text: How is it declared by the wise, as this is truth, that is nonexistence
Without apprehending them, the world also does not wish for self
Eternal, non-eternal and others' production is taken away by wrong view
For whom beings are perceived truly, their essences are clear

children.text: tatra liṅgādayo doṣāḥ prajāyante na vā kathaṃ || Yukti_44
children.translated_text: There, how do signs and other defects arise, or not arise?

children.text: yān hi dharmānupādāya dṛṣṭaścandro jale yathā |
children.translated_text: As the moon is seen in the water without comprehending it

children.text: tatra satyam mṛṣā naiva kāmaṃ dṛṣṭyā na hāritaḥ || Yukti_45
children.translated_text: There, truth is not false, desire is not lost by view
Born of passion and aversion, intense is the grasp of wrong view
Disputes arise along with acceptance of existence

children.text: sa hetuḥ sarvadṛṣṭīnām kleśotpatti rna tam vinā |
children.translated_text: That cause is the origin of all views of affliction, not without it
Therefore, with it understood, defilement and affliction are reduced
How is realization? By viewing the rise of dependent origination
The best of the knowers of truth says, depending arisen and unborn
Who abides in truth, overcoming false knowledge,
Attachment, and of unstable thought, regarded as the activity of passion in stages

children.text: mahātmanām na pakṣo vā vitarko vā na vidyate |
children.translated_text: The great-souled ones have no side or imagination

children.text: yeṣām na vidyate pakṣeḥ parapakṣaḥ kutasteṣām || Yukti_50
children.translated_text: For whom there is no faction, how can opponents exist for them?
Where residing, bitten by the snakes of afflictions

children.text: calaṃ vāniṣṭhitam cittaṃ na tiṣṭhatyanāśritam || Yukti_51
children.translated_text: The mind fluctuates or remains unsteady without residence

children.text: sāśraya cittavāna sattveḥ kleśodbhūto viṣo mahān |
children.translated_text: With support, the mind persists in beings, a great poison from afflictions

children.text: sadā pṛthagajano hīnaḥ kleśasarpena gṛhītaḥ || Yukti_52
children.translated_text: The common people are always inferior, grasped by the serpent of afflictions

children.text: prativimbe yathā rāgo loke ca mohavandhanāt |
children.translated_text: As in the reflection is attachment, in the world too due to the bonds of delusion

children.text: viṣayapinjaro sakto bālo hi satyasamjñayā || Yukti_53
children.translated_text: Restricted in the cage of sense objects, the child by false perception
With eyes, he sees names of objects by perception of form
As the state of the great soul is unattached in the mire of actions
People stuck to forms are deluded, middling are those free of passion

children.text: rūpasvabhāvavijño yo vimukto buddhimān paraḥ || Yukti_55
children.translated_text: He who knows the nature of form is liberated, the wise beyond others
Having opened the thought of happiness, devoid of both desire and aversion
By the vision of knowing illusion as a deceit, he will be restrained
Who is scorched by false knowledge, becomes one sharing in the defects of afflictions
Knowledge of meaning is not borne from conception of being and non-being
Those free of desire indeed become free from attachment,

children.text: arāge rāgavardhāste na sāśrayā mahātmanaḥ || Yukti_58
children.translated_text: Without desire, attachment does not increase, nor do they rely on support
The minds of those of distinct consciousness are unstable and restless,
Even if churned by the snake of defilement, he is unworried from the ocean of existence

children.text: śāstreṇānena janānām punyam jñānam ca sancitam |
children.translated_text: By this scripture, the people's merit and wisdom are gathered
Arisen from the virtuous actions born of wisdom, both the supreme should be attained therefore

body.translated_text: Like the core of a plantain tree, like the city of the Gandharvas,
Thus, the treatise of Yukti-Sixty is complete
From the mouth of the venerable <s>Nāgārjuna</s>, this scripture

children.translated_text: Listened to by the Indian Pandit <s>Muditaśri</s>
And by the Tibetan inhabitant, named <s>Sūryakīrti</s> of the Pātchava region
Written by the Tibetan Pandit in the Tibetan language
